hints.content:
There are $\maroonD{10}$ groups of $\blueD{10}$.

![Same image with each group labeled, plus 10](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/00de36751d70711d5b3656109817a0cfd212a4e9) ![continuation of previous image](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/00de36751d70711d5b3656109817a0cfd212a4e9)

options.explanation:
$\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{10}=\maroonD{10}\blueD{\text{ tens}}$.

That's the same as $\maroonD{5}\blueD{\text{ tens}}+\maroonD{5}\blueD{\text{ tens}}$.

![The same image with a dividing line making 5 groups of 10 on the top, labeled 5 times 10 equals 50](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/2356ca0d037a10505d6e18ecc24bb06824e4b42f)

![and 5 groups of 10 on the bottom labeled, 5 times 10 equals 50](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/a8ee13f308a81ccaa5c8c60ad609b6981800e88b)

There are $\redD{50}+\purpleC{50}=\greenD{100}$ total printers.

So $\maroonD{10}\times\blueD{10}=\greenD{100}$.

question.content:
**Multiply.**
*Hint: Use the picture below to help solve the equation.*

$10 \times 10 = $ [[☃ numeric-input 1]]

![10 groups of 10](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/05288c231dd2233faa75e329f3e3b31b73a535c8) ![continuation of previous image](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/05288c231dd2233faa75e329f3e3b31b73a535c8)
